title: Simulation-Based Education for Digital Privacy Protection

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of personal information concepts and fundamental smartphone functionality
context.additional_context: Practical approaches linked to mathematics curriculum, including data protection probability calculations, implemented through smartphone application-based simulation environments

learning_goals: Learners demonstrate the ability to identify the purpose of personal information collection with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can apply at least three privacy protection measures (e.g., two-factor authentication, location information restrictions) in simulation scenarios.
In a follow-up evaluation three months after training, over 60% of learners report sustaining privacy protection behaviors in real-life situations.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
